result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexia A Morrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $500.00 BAIL APPLIED. Restitution of $15,461.00 to Chubb Insurance and $15.00 to Chase Bank to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.  Shall never work in the caregiving field.

No Contact with the victim or her residence listed in the criminal complaint. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - 12 months Huber, last 7 months STAYED; to be used at the Agent's discretion. Credit for 82 days. Commencing forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 282 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Cases 19CF0735 and 16CF0267

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.
Costs previously imposed, to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Restitution previously imposed to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.   Court ordered financial obligations and restitution payable out of inmate's funds while incarcerated.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Attend a Criminal Thinking course as recommended by agent. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison

02:14 PM Defendant Alexia A Morrison in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms with counsel that they have received and reviewed the Revocation Order and Warrant.  Court reviews the recommendations in the report.  State presents their recommendations for sentencing.  Atty. Menden presents her recommendations for sentencing.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 3:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

6 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 282 days - Concurrent to the sentence in 16CF267 & 19CF735)
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances without a valid prescriptiuon or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
Criminal Thinking course as recommended by the Agent.

*ANY Outstanding Restitution/Court Costs/DNA surcharge to be paid from prison wages and/or to be paid as a condition of extended supervision*

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 9, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 22, 2019 at 09:30 am.

Order to impose condition time - signed by Judge Lazar 04-23-19
Proposed Order extending probation for unpaid court obligations submitted by Agent Peters-Garay.

03:03 PM Defendant Alexia A Morrison in court.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Peters-Garay appeared in court on behalf of DOC.  Case called for hearing to address memo from Agent Peters-Garay for extension of probation.  Court reviews the memo and Agent's requests on the record.  Defendant confirms she is disputing the requests of the Agent.  Agent Peter-Garay presents statements and is asking the Court grant her request to order the defendant serve 3 months of the stayed condition time and extend probation.  Defendant presents statements and advises that she has $10.00 to pay today towards the restutition.  Court will approve the request for use of stayed condition time of 3 months and will sign the proposed order previously submitted by the Agent.  Court notes that leaves the request to extend supervision for unpaid court costs and restitution.  Court questions the defendant with regards to hours she worked and why money was not paid towards restitution.  Defendant responds.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant the request to extend probation for 2 years from 10/25/2019 to 10/25/2021 or until all obligations are completed and will sign the order submitted by the Agent.  Court orders the 3 months of condition time Huber with release for work treatment and/or counseling and child care, that was previously stayed, be commenced forthwith.  Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff.
Proposed Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions
